articles.content:
DPRK Anniversaries to Be Commemorated in Tanzania 
   Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- An inaugural ceremony of the Tanzanian National Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Day of the Sun and February 16 in 2007 was held in Dar-Es-Salaam on Dec. 2.
 The minister of Information, Culture and Sports, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee at the ceremony.    
 The preparatory committee set the period of commemoration from Dec. 2, 2006, to Apr. 20, 2007, and decided to organize colorful events during the period.

articles.content:
U.S. Intervention Rejected in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification reportedly made public a statement on Dec. 5 in denunciation of the reckless remarks by William Perry, former U.S. secretary of Defense, who openly showed hostility towards the south Korean people's anti-American sentiments.
 The statement referred to the fact that on Dec. 1, Perry showed enmity toward the anti-U.S. struggle of the south Korean people of different social standings, who gave defeat to the pro-U.S. traitorous "Grand National Party" in the "presidential election" in 2002, and blared the south Korean "government" should not use anti-U.S. sentiments.    
 The anti-American sentiments growing in south Korean society are entirely attributable to all sorts of crimes committed by the U.S. there south Korea, the statement said, adding: the U.S. would be well advised to mind its own business, clearly seeing its present position.

Greetings to President of Burkina Faso
   Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greetings to Blaise Compaore, President of Burkina Faso, on the occasion of the national day of his country. 
 The message expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future.

Pamphlet "Down-with-Imperialism Union" Issued in Peru
articles.content:
Korean People's Efforts for Peace Supported in Chad
   Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Chad is opposed to any threat of armed forces to the Korean Peninsula and supports the Korean people's efforts for peace.
 President of Chad Idriss Deby said this when receiving credentials from the DPRK Ambassador E.P. to Chad Kim Pyong Gi on Nov. 30.    
 The president said he has always followed the situation on the Korean Peninsula with attention.

articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Stop Anti-Reunification Plots
   Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The European Regional Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification reportedly made public a statement on Dec. 2 to denounce the south Korean police authorities for arresting and investigating Kang Sun Jong, advisor to the Reunification Solidarity of south Korea, on the charges of violation of the "National Security Law" and "espionage."
 The statement said that the recent ceaseless plots hatched by the pro-U.S. conservative forces including the Grand National Party of south Korea are nothing but anachronistic reckless actions to check the nationwide movement for reunification and wrest power, taking advantage of the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK.    
 Branding the pro-U.S. conservative forces in south Korea as sycophantic traitors leaving the destiny of the nation to the tender mercy of outside forces, the statement demanded they stop at once hatching plots against the June 15 era of reunification and repeal the anti-reunification law NSL.

articles.content:
Greetings to Popular Liberation Movement of Angola
   Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Saturday sent a message of greetings to the Central Committee of the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola today on its golden jubilee.
 The message said that in the past five decades the movement put an end to the colonial rule of the imperialists and achieved the national independence through its long armed struggle and gained great successes in its efforts for national reconciliation and unity and stability and reconstruction of the country after the independence.    
 Expressing the belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the WPK and the movement would further expand and develop in the interests of the two parties and the two peoples, the message wished the movement greater success in the work for its development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: South Korean Security Authorities' Fascist Outrage under Fire
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Vietnamese PM
   Pyongyang, December 9 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of sympathy to Nguyen Tan Dung, Prime Minister of Vietnam, in connection with the cyclone that hit the central and southern parts of Vietnam, causing big human and material losses.
 Extending deep sympathy and consolation to the Vietnamese government and the population in the afflicted areas, the message expressed belief that the prime minister and his government would eradicate the aftermath of the natural disaster and bring their living to normal as early as possible.
